title: Penzance to Marazion Coastal Path Walk Route

images.title: Mari Buckley / The inner harbour, Penzance
images.caption: The inner harbour, Penzance. The fishing boats are all safely moored up in the inner harbour at Penzance, as is the Scillonian III, which has just pulled in alongside the Lighthouse Pier 5 minutes beforehand, after her return trip from the Isles of Scilly.

images.title: Colin Roderick / Mounts Bay Lugger
images.caption: Mounts Bay Lugger. One of the few surviving Mounts Bay Luggers, taken in Mounts Bay off Chyandour Cliff.

images.title: Bob Embleton / Rocky outcrop, Chyandour, Penzance
images.caption: Rocky outcrop, Chyandour, Penzance Rocks on the otherwise sandy beach on what started as a damp and leaden sunday morning in August as we ventured to St. Michael's mount (in the distance) and back.

images.title: Rod Allday / The beach at Long Rock
images.caption: The beach at Long Rock

images.title: Pauline Eccles, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath through Marazion Marsh Nature Reserve

images.title: Bob Embleton / The Square, Marazion
images.caption: The Square, Marazion. Where North Street (on the right) meets the Market Place. Behind the girls seated on the bench is an inscribed stone explaining that Marazion means "Thursday Market".

images.title: Bob Jones / Marazion Marsh
images.caption: Marazion Marsh. The fence and the locked gate divide the public area on the right (east) from the non-accessible bird sanctuary to the left (west).

images.title: Sarah Charlesworth / Low tide at Marazion
images.caption: Low tide at Marazion

description: This walk takes you along the coast path from Penzance to Marazion. It's about a 3 mile walk, running along the beach between the two Cornish settlements. You start off at the train station at Penzance and head east along the waymarked St Michaels Way to Marazion. Here you can pay a visit to St Michael's Mount where you'll find a 12th century medieval church and castle on an island which is reachable from Marazion by a man-made causeway of granite setts, passable between mid-tide and low water. Also in the area is the lovely Marazion Marsh RSPB reserve where you can look out for a variety of wildlife.
